poem:
### The Whisper's Art

In the luxury of shadows,  
tongues weave fragile threads—  
a tapestry of half-truths,  
dangling over chasms  
of unspoken hearts.  
Words skim the surface,  
ripples on a silk pond,  
feeding the ravenous void,  
the hunger for stories  
laced with unvoiced sadness,  
a fleeting sense of belonging.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Everybody does it’: Why we all love a good gossip, from The White Lotus, to books and podcasts In the latest series of The White Lotus, childhood best friends Laurie, Kate and Jaclyn arrive at a luxury Thai hotel for a girls’ ­holiday. The trio appears to have a perfect dynamic, but on the first night, two friends descend into a gossiping session about the third, crystallising unspoken tensions in the group. Gossip drives all". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
